subject: Fashion
title: Ballroom Culture and Fashion
description: Learn Ballroom Culture and Fashion in one minute.

hook.text: In 1960s Harlem, Black and Latino queer youth created the ballroom scene to survive rejection.

buildup.text: Houses like LaBeija and Xtravaganza became chosen families. Balls were their fashion runways.

discovery.text: Voguingâ€”the dance inspired by magazine posesâ€”turned Vogue covers into a full-body art form.

twist.text: Madonna's 1990 hit 'Vogue' brought ballroom to the mainstream but barely credited its creators.

climax.text: Ballroom invented the fierceness that now fills every runway. High fashion took from the margins.

punchline.text: The runway copied ballroomâ€”not the other way around.

quiz.question: What is the relationship between ballroom culture and mainstream fashion?
options: Ballroom culture originated fashion trends that high fashion later adopted
Fashion designers created ballroom style for queer communities
Both evolved independently with no significant influence on each other
